page.title: 09JOBS IN THE GRAYS AREA
page.content: A class of children has written of the jobs being done by their parents or other people in the locality. Most of the male workers are employed full-time. Many of the females work part-time or have jobs which they can do at home;several of them having sewing machines on which they make up ready-cut-out garments. Large firms such as Fords, Van den Berg and Jergens, Shell and Esso were mentioned. People also work in the town centre shops or in local firms such as Celcon, New World Kitchens, the Sugar Factory and locally based Container Companies. The jobs they do include welding,case making,typing and storekeeping, nursing, restocking shelves and serving drinks. In this small survey only two are self-employed.
